The Hilton-Parma Make a Difference Day Committee was awarded complimentary Disney Theme Park tickets in recognition of our volunteers’ commitment to improving our community and helping to set a great example for kids and families.

Families of current Hilton Central School District students were invited to enter the Disney Theme Park Ticket Contest earlier this year; however the drawing was canceled due to COVID-19. The drawing has been rescheduled for Thursday, July 16 at 10 a.m. Five families from the current list of entries will be randomly selected to receive two Disney Park Hopper Tickets each. Tickets are valued at $169-$199 each.

The drawing will be recorded and shared on the district website, Facebook and Twitter pages. Tickets may be picked up during business hours at the Quest Security Desk, 225 West Ave., between July 17-24, 2020. Face masks and identification are required at the time of pick up. https://www.hilton.k12.ny.us/news.cfm?story=1164&

Congratulations to senior trombonist Gavin Anderson who was recently accepted as a performing member of the Eastman Youth Jazz Orchestra for the 2020- 2021 school year. The Eastman Youth Jazz Orchestra meets every Saturday and Monday, and performs regularly at the Rochester Jazz Festival. In order to be considered for the group, Gavin completed an audition, performing a jazz solo festival étude, sight read a jazz excerpt, and was also asked to improvise.

Gavin is a member of the Hilton High School Wind Ensemble and is also a 2020-2021 Wind Ensemble officer.

Emma Doughty, a graduating senior at Hilton Central School District and a member of NYSED’s Youth Advisory Panel, has excelled in many endeavors, and her hard work has been recognized locally and nationally.

The Youth Advisory Panel is one of NYSED’s primary stakeholder groups. It is composed of students with disabilities who are appointed by the Assistant Commissioner of Special Education to advise NYSED from a first-hand perspective on ways to improve the quality of special education services and student outcomes. Emma’s work with the Youth Advisory Panel figured prominently in her college entrance and scholarship essay, which resulted in multiple scholarships and awards.

Emma’s efforts have stretched outside the classroom as she has taken her focus and skill into her job as a lifeguard. Her influence continues into the community-at-large, where she has presented to large groups of high school, undergraduate, and graduate students about her personal experiences being deaf and the importance of inclusion.

Read more about Emma here: https://bit.ly/2X4UKQB #ClassOf2020

Local chef Cruz Nieves from Rella Restaurant in Rochester stopped by on Dec. 18 to help the students make lunches for the Open Door Mission. Each lunch consisted of a carefully made peanut butter and jelly sandwich and an orange. Stephanie Hanna, special education teacher, arranged the visit. She also worked with Tricia Clasgens' second grade class to have the students write notes of kindness to put in each of the lunch bags. "We have talked quite a bit about acts of kindness and connected this with citizenship between the classes," said Hanna.

The Open Door Mission in Rochester provides shelter and bedding each night for up to 40 homeless men and 10 homeless women.

Allison Mattle and Andre Watson, percussionists in the Hilton High School Wind Ensemble, participated in the 198th Army Band Rehearsal on Nov. 23. Andre and Allison practiced alongside professional Army musicians during their two-hour rehearsal and also received individual lessons with the ensemble's percussionists.

Allison and Andre were selected based on teacher recommendation, ensemble and solo experience, as well as contributions within the high school music program. Both juniors, Allison and Andre are members of the Wind Ensemble, Marching Band and Indoor Winter Drumline. In October, they were also selected to participate in the Roberts Wesleyan Honors Band.
